definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
surname Qian
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: There exist a fact that most of us will undoubtedly be greedy at the sight of money.
sentences.chinese: 有一個事實我們不能否定就是大多數人都是見錢眼開。

sentences.english: Yulan's father, Zhu Daji, agrees to sell his ancestral house to the government.
sentences.chinese: 玉蘭的父親朱大吉見錢眼開，竟將祖屋授權給政府。

sentences.english: There is no need to waste energy to contact a person seeks.
sentences.chinese: 也沒有必要浪費精力去交往一個見錢眼開的人。

sentences.english: You are too easily influenced by money.
Mummy and Daddy do not actually want Justin to become a child who sees only money.
sentences.chinese: 爸比媽咪並不希望大貝貝變成見錢眼開的小孩。

definition: vain
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: glib of tongue (idiom)/eloquent
see 謾罵|谩骂[man4 ma4]
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
(not) a single person/(no) one
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
exceptionally intelligent (idiom)
trivial matter/a piece of cake
to boast
Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
narrow/petty-minded
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
